CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 12, 1953, pg. 15 reads: "Civil Defense Nursing Grads - Women are still continuing to pursue courses in interest of our country. The following women have recently completed courses in home nursing and civil defense and are now qualified to act in that capacity.  The first class (above) included Mmes. Blanche Mock, Anna Mae Green, Cora Warren, Pearl Lane, Jessie B. Ray, Doris Willis, Margaret Oliver, Mattie Lumsford, Margaret Miller, Carrie Smith and Miss Frances Brown...Classes were under the direction of Mrs. Eunice W. Cook, assistant director at Hill City Youth Municipality."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of graduating nurses for completion of in home nursing and civil defense classes, including: Blanche Mock, Anna Mae Green, Cora Warren, Pearl Lane, Jessie B. Ray, Doris Willis, Margaret Oliver, Mattie Lumsford, Margaret Miller, Carrie Smith and Frances Brown, with Eunice Cook standing center right, gathered around table with Red Cross flag in interior with sign that reads "The Red Cross Services Home Nursing, Junior Red Cross, Nutrition Service First Aid"
